member.name: M:Microsoft.PointOfService.BaseServiceObjects.PosPrinterBase.PrintTwoNormal(Microsoft.PointOfService.PrinterStation,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Prints two strings on two print stations simultaneously. When supported, this may give increased print performance.
member.param: The printer stations to be used. Possible values are defined by the PrinterStation enumeration. Valid values are: PrinterStation.TwoReceiptJournal, PrinterStation.TwoSlipJournal, or PrinterStation.TwoSlipReceipt.

The characters to be printed on the second station. (Restrictions are the same as data1.) If this string is the empty string (“”), then print the same data as data1. On some printers, using this format may give additional increased print performance.

The characters to be printed on the first station. May consist of printable characters and escape sequences as listed in the topic. The characters must all fit on one printed line, so that the printer may attempt to print on both stations simultaneously.

The characters to be printed on the second station. (Restrictions are the same as data1.) If this string is the empty string (“”), then print the same data as data1. On some printers, using this format may give additional increased print performance.
